column5: My fianc√© and I are both young looking and people always ask how far apart we are as if we‚Äôre siblings. We look nothing alike. I‚Äôm blonde he‚Äôs brunette i have blue eyes and freckles and he‚Äôs tan/olive with green eyes. It makes NO sense to me!!
Hair spray! It takes ink out like a charm.

I feel for you. My sister in law took her own life last October because my brother was fairly similar to this. He worked nights, slept all day, and used his free time to golf. I‚Äôm proud of you for pulling through for your kids and yourself. I‚Äôve had serious conversations with my fianc√© already about splitting house work and overall duties and explained that women in this position are more likely to take their own life or even leave/divorce. I‚Äôll pray he finds the strength for himself and his kids because if he even manages to get custody he has a LONG way to go.
That‚Äôs why most women, even heterosexual women, watch lesbian porn. Much more pleasure oriented and not so aggressive.

DHS/CPS/Social Workers all around struggle to be effective. Many times they are assigned far too many cases for one person. It‚Äôs possible your social worker is seeing your situation as less dire considering they literally enter homes where grandfathers rape infants. Furthermore, even with all the proper reporting it takes a LONG time to genuinely get an effective order put in place. I worked at a daycare in a poor neighborhood and I cannot tell you how many things I reported and all it did was further ‚Äúbuild a case.‚Äù They ‚Äútry‚Äù to document and collect as much evidence for a stronger trial in the meantime subjecting children to still live with their abusers. In states like mine, Iowa, governors are trying to further make CPS/Social Work privatized, which would only make matters worse. :(

It‚Äôs intentional. Aristotle explains in The Politics that tyrannical government use two party systems to keep the people divided and unprogressive. Ever consider why the US also doesn‚Äôt provide higher education? The less educated the people are the more likely they are to fall into these lazy thought patterns of ideology based on two groups for a myriad of issues.

The issue is CNN was the first 24 hour news cast in 1980. News doesn‚Äôt need to run 24 hours unless you want it filled with nonsense and propaganda. If they reported on what was pertinent then they wouldn‚Äôt operate 24/7.

My mom is a primary nurse for an OBGYN and when my sister was diagnosed her OB suggested surgery where they put the ovaries to sleep and they can go back and ‚Äúwake them up‚Äù when she‚Äôs ready for children. Luckily it was a misdiagnosis but perhaps this surgery could be an option!

That‚Äôs amazing that you have that much impulse control/overall self control. KUDOS TO YOU!! I‚Äôm sorry to hear about your coworkers, I often felt the same way after work but thankfully no one ever personally told me i was ‚Äútoo much‚Äù so it was more of how i perceived their reaction to my mood and i was able to calm down by reminding myself, I‚Äôm not a mind reader so I could be projecting OR remembering I hardly remember shit people do so it‚Äôs likely they aren‚Äôt thinking twice about it. I recently ordered this Dialectical Behavioral Therapy work book and it‚Äôs on the way still but this therapy approach is one worth reading into for you! Like you, I‚Äôm unable to just move past emotions or understand them so this book allows you to integrate your split thinking into a wholesome mindset. Best of luck love thanks for sharing your story and I hope mine can show you that you aren‚Äôt totally fucked compared to the use I and others below have been but use that as fuel to stay afloat like you are with your use before it‚Äôs abuse. Stay healthy I‚Äôm sending lots of love :)

Yeah i feel a lot of the same ways. And don‚Äôt get me wrong haha i definitely was able to get my shit done but i would take forever to start and doing it usually annoyed me bc I wasn‚Äôt smoking. I mostly just hated how dirty my house was though bc if things didn‚Äôt have a deadline and it wasn‚Äôt affecting anyone besides myself, I didn‚Äôt do it. I was a master of just saying ‚Äúafter I smoke I‚Äôll do it‚Äù or ‚Äúafter this trap nap‚Äù lmao

I was like this for the past 4 years. I smoked like 3 blunts a day (an eighth A DAY) until I switched to wax which i blew through 1g carts in about 5 days. Eventually I got tired of the cycle where I felt sad and empty unless I was high, because when the weed wore off it was evident it wasn‚Äôt helping. The breaking point for me was when I was practically anorexic bc my tolerance was so high I couldn‚Äôt smoke enough weed to get hungry. I also grew the inability to sleep 8 hours a night because I would wake up once the weed wore off. Lastly, it made doing everything harder. Working out, cleaning the house, yard work, my school work, etc. all of those things I realized make me feel more accomplished and genuinely happy when i completes them and weed was standing in my way of being proactive and genuinely content with my daily activities. I know this isn‚Äôt easy but slowly push yourself to sit with those emotions for 5 minutes before sparking, then 15, 30 min, even push yourself to an hour and maybe tell yourself ‚Äúif you clean the bathroom you can smoke‚Äù or something like that. I‚Äôm not saying you should quit but smoking weed all day every day isn‚Äôt ideal for anyone. (Also not trying to imply you do, but I‚Äôm sure others may) It‚Äôs much better when only consumed at most once a day but I grew to quit buying weed and now i only smoke when I‚Äôm with my smoking friends and they smoke me up. They know i don‚Äôt smoke or buy but they love to offer so I don‚Äôt mind bc it‚Äôs more social now than a dependency.
Amazon sells TONS of sets with 20+ items. Weed through the reviews and if they check out I think it‚Äôs worth it because they really are affordable but have SO many.

Right, it‚Äôs not like we even want their ‚Äúpraise‚Äù anyways. I‚Äôd rather they not say anything at all than say fake shit.

Oof. That‚Äôs so frustrating because some people could disregard your experience by saying things like ‚Äúat least your dad threw you a party.‚Äù But people don‚Äôt realize the ‚Äúnice‚Äù things they do aren‚Äôt nice to us.

Oof that sucks when you don‚Äôt even have the discretion to share your own achievements to avoid her accessing your stuff. Thanks for your kind wishes and I‚Äôm proud of your accomplishments too! College sports are BEYOND time consuming and draining.

Thank you for your kind words and love! :) But i sadly relate to the lack of respect for boundaries. I tell my mom soooo bluntly and clearly what she CANNOT do and she will literally do it the next day. Worst of all a boundary of mine is to not bring up my sexual abuse from my childhood AT ALL. She brings it up at least bi-weekly. After my wedding I‚Äôm going no contact bc she‚Äôs offering to pay for my wedding so fuck it, I‚Äôll use her money and dip out. She can feel what it‚Äôs like to be used for personal gain for once and I have ZERO guilt bc after 22 years I‚Äôve had enough :/

Definitely. Subconscious messages are learned by the age of 7 and they‚Äôre near impossible to get rid of. The whole time i went through school, if I ever performed poorly I would go down a rabbit hole of ‚Äúsee, you can‚Äôt do it! You really are a piece of shit. You really can‚Äôt do anything even when you try your hardest.‚Äù School work was half the battle when I was struggling with self esteem. I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre experiencing the same thoughts. As the years climb that I‚Äôve been moved out I‚Äôm slowly experiencing less self esteem issues.
And I REALLY appreciate it. Thanks for the love üíó

Such a horrible series of stories but I will add I love the way you write haha so it was interesting to read. It sucks when parents KNOW the day should be about YOU so they act 10x worse bc they cannot handle it that a day is literally focused on someone other than them. But the make up comments really pissed me off. What a piece of work sheeeeeesh. Thankfully her friend tried to stick up for you!

My parents don‚Äôt even exert the energy to make their own posts lmao. They share my post and add a small blurb ‚Äúi couldn‚Äôt be prouder of my smart girl.‚Äù And it bothers me bc obviously they aren‚Äôt directly complimenting me, but I get tired of every post of mine being shared by my mom AND my dad bc then I feel like people are getting annoyed bc often times they are friends with all three of us and sure our friends care I graduated college, but I‚Äôm sure they‚Äôve annoyed to see THREE different posts every single time I accomplish something. I‚Äôm not a vain person but they make me feel so vain when they use me and try to boast to the world shit me, my siblings, and even my nieces/nephews accomplish or celebrate.

PLEASE take the power back and immerse yourself in your hobbies. My parents crushed every dream I had as a kid and I had to quit dance when I was 8 because my brothers were nationally ranked wrestlers so we ALL had to commit to traveling nationally because their accomplishments were the only thing that gave my parents a decent reputation. I used to sing all the time and my mom told me choir, and band are FOR GAY PEOPLE. Literally. So i quit trying to be theatrical and more practical. I‚Äôve lost touch with those passions bc they were killed when I was 8. Please get in touch with that part of yourself before it‚Äôs out of reach. Wishing you luck!

I hate that I‚Äôm not surprised. Creating, starting, and fully operating a business takes some MAJOR balls and intelligence. Overall though i recognize the skill and strength you have and as creative as you sound I‚Äôm sure you can find a name way more personal than your last name, after all it doesn‚Äôt seem like a name you care to be proud of if that‚Äôs how they act :(

Ugh I hate that we‚Äôre in the same boat. I‚Äôm SO proud of you for traveling to a foreign country where you pry can‚Äôt speak to more than half the people or roads and we‚Äôre able to return in one piece. Ugh that‚Äôs so repulsive. My mom reacted similar when I told her I got in to my college. I experienced serious educational neglect my whole life. My sophomore year of high school I realized I didn‚Äôt want to be stuck in my community with my family after high school. So I buckled down and seriously took my cum gpa from 1.25 to 3.25 by my senior year. I was conditionally accepted to my university bc of my grades and ACT score but i was over the moon nonetheless and when i got in she didn‚Äôt even say anything she got up and walked out of the room. I‚Äôm proud of you and I‚Äôm sorry that we can relate over the fact that our mothers will never be the person we need in life. Take care doll.

I‚Äôm sorry to hear about your experiences. I‚Äôm glade we can relate and I gave you the space to share your experience. Take care and I‚Äôm proud of everything you‚Äôve accomplished despite having some intense adverse childhood affects.

I appreciate this so much. Thank you so much and for what it‚Äôs worth I‚Äôm proud of you too! Recognizing these patterns is a feat in itself but to dare yourself to try something as hard as school is something to be proud of. I definitely battled those subconscious messages of ‚Äúyou can‚Äôt do it‚Äù constantly. Thank you for your support and energy. :)

Reality is 150% what you make it. If you are in a fixed mindset that you are inherently unexceptional, or unskilled, you will ultimately attract that energy and make choices with those subconscious thoughts. If you manifest a reality where you believe you have the potential to put any of your thoughts or dreams into action you will soon realize it truly is what you make it. It‚Äôs a matter of making your CONSCIOUS thoughts stronger than that of your subconscious. I hope you find it within yourself to grant grace and love to yourself.

I feel like the word ‚Äúego‚Äù has so many different meanings and connotations. I wish people would realize ego is more than your pride. I think of it as it‚Äôs the entire idea of who ‚Äúyou‚Äù are, which is why i think a lot of people mistake it for pride. Sharing a common meaning of ego would make it easier to help others find empathy, in my opinion, because rather than trying to become aware of any pride they have they could actually become aware that maybe they‚Äôre ONLY seeing things from THEIR perspective of their ego.

Try and think of like three examples of other people saying embarrassing or awkward things... chances are you can‚Äôt or it takes a CONSCIOUS effort to try. YOU are YOUR own biggest critic. I do that all the time, classic anxiety. My sister committed suicide a year ago and let me tell you the pain may (or may not who knows) stop for you because you pass it to everyone you leave. Yes. If BPD has been developed due to trauma it‚Äôs likely from trying to always feel out your abusers mood, or you‚Äôre used to walking on eggshells. Therefor your fight and flight were triggered more as a child and as an adult now we are hypersensitive to pretty much everything. You can do more research on being an ‚Äúempath,‚Äù but essentially we‚Äôre social sponges and we absorb A LOT of energy from other people so be mindful so you can pick and choose who you you‚Äôre around because their vibe/energy can and will drain you if you let it.

Good for you for standing up to her! At my university I took a class called The Maternal Process, and she warned us repeatedly that others see a pregnancy as the world‚Äôs pregnancy and feel they can touch your belly. She said she only ever let little old ladies if they seemed really sweet üòÖ

My dad had a temper growing up and he often beat the absolute shit out of our dogs, and me and my siblings. If that‚Äôs how he expresses his anger you may be right about how we would express his anger to a child. You could encourage him to take proper steps like dialectical therapy, anger management, perhaps mood stabilizing medication etc. Please do this for your kid, I ask as a child who used to put on every pair of underwear and swim bottoms when I knew I messed up bc I expected a BRUTAL beating.

Been with my fianc√© since age 13 (going 8 years solid) and getting married in September. I had ‚Äúdated‚Äù some other guys before him (lol middle school relationships) and I always felt some amount of pressure to act and look a certain way around them. Often those were the guys who would ask for nudes or try and hook up just to brag about it. Anyways, when i met my fianc√© i knew he was my soul mate because I never felt any pressure to change who I was to ‚Äúwin him over.‚Äù It was natural, i never felt any fear about breaking up i never felt anxious about whether he felt the same. When you can 150% be yourself in every way and not feel any judgement, it‚Äôs real. I‚Äôve had so much doubt casted my way and I just ignored it. Also if you want to ‚Äúcheck‚Äù if you‚Äôre being naive just try to imagine what it would be like leaving them and finding a new partner, if you find that you don‚Äôt want to give up all their amazing qualities and love, it‚Äôs real. If you think that you can do better or they could treat you better, you‚Äôre maybe too attached/codependent to realize (also a downside of high school sweethearts)

I feel this too. My mom was a narcissist so it was like jumping through hoops and manipulations for love lol. Psychs also made me aware of those things on trips, which in turn has made me aware of my lack of self love. I got tired of feeling that way and seeking it for so long I began focusing on genuinely embracing my own presence and energy. Furthermore, psychs can make you feel lonely because as you change your perspective on life you may want to change relationships/standards or overall feel like not many others around you can relate to you anymore. Good luck on your emotional journey and always have patience for yourself bc this isn‚Äôt your fault.

I feel like these are apples and oranges. I liked Amy a lot at the start of her career, and her series on Comedy Central. But her stand up specials are repetitive, and she often uses the same exact jokes on interviews (specifically her joke about her arms registering as legs in LA in her special and on Ellen.) it‚Äôs obvious her contents written by a team, which is common. 
Dave however takes genuine BOLD stances of his own inception. He‚Äôs the goat and constantly keeps it real and NEW.

I come from a family where every single couple ended in divorce and my parents was especially toxic. I swore love was only in the movies (even as a kid.) When i was 12 i met my fianc√© at a little league baseball game and he was walking laps around the playground trying to get my attention. I eventually yelled at him to come over and i immediately told him his shoes were ugly lol. He got my number before we left and a year later he called me from memory when he got a cellphone. We started dating when we were 13, been going rock solid for 8 years and getting married in September. It took time to trust and let his love in but once I did, I knew it was real and it‚Äôs only grown deeper. :)

My sister in law was in your exact same shoes with my brother. It‚Äôs so sad and I only say this to you because your husband, and you, have to understand you CANNOT continue like this. He must take your seriously and if he doesn‚Äôt do what you can to get yourself some resources. Motherhood can be a mental illness under certain circumstances.

I did ballet from age 3-18 and I really miss it! I was never good, and didn‚Äôt attend anywhere fancy. But simply doing bar work and working on balance and core was some of the best leg and butt workouts ever! You will be sore for sure but it‚Äôs definitely something that less aggressive on the body, kind of like yoga. It‚Äôs a good thing to simply stretch. And you can modify the intensity of your workout bc you can dance really slow while maintaining technique, or you can dance as fast as you want!

Yes!! I began using psychedelics as a sophomore in college, i was 20 at the time. Since I began tripping I am more self aware, I have a better understanding and more peace with my place in the universe, and it also gave me a new sense of meaning. I‚Äôve never been religious but psychs have made me more spiritual for sure. I also noticed I do better in school bc I understand the way my brain works and i recognize my thought patterns. I‚Äôm also MUCH better at manifesting my goals, dreams, and desires bc I realize if you want something you must put in the work. Psychs have been long used even way back to Egyptians eras. I don‚Äôt have my own kids but intend to raise them to be self aware and less egotistical than others. And i will encourage psychedelic use once they are 18+. My own father shares some of his experiences with me now that he knows i use psychs too.

You should consider filing a police report. I don‚Äôt think you have to press charges but i would FOR SURE get this documented and set a tone that you won‚Äôt take this shit. If nothing else take photos of any injury, and write down what happened, date and sign and get your brother to also. document, document, DOCUMENT!
Because everyone across the road fuels their ego and public image and everyone at home knows the true true.

Yes!! I think i have the empathy for my SO bc they genuinely do show me how much they love and care about me. But i literally have no girl friends because I get upset the second I think I‚Äôm being rejected or that I care/put more energy than they do. I have one remaining best friend and I have gradually had to force myself to accept the relationship for what it is; and to accept that they will never care or show love to me the way I would. I think a lot of BPD, for sure myself, try to literally treat everyone how they would want to be treated. And it‚Äôs BEYOND the golden rule bc we love to LOVE and care about people so often times the way we treat people is beyond what they would ever consider doing for us. Kind of a sick joke really to be such a beautifully deep person and live such a lonely existence.

I definitely noticed myself not struggling as much at my university. I recall taking Organizational Psychology and the exams were TOUGH. I decided to take some LSD and study, however I ended up only studying for like 15 minutes. The next day I took the test still tripping and I recalled all of the information i studied for those few minutes, AND i could visibly see and hear my professors lectures on certain questions to find the answers. I got an A and that alone helped me pass the class.

(Woman‚Äôs advice) my fianc√© is a smaller build and is often referred to as a ‚Äúpussy‚Äù by other men OFTEN. But my advice to you is, don‚Äôt change. This reminds me of when I had my first solo trip ever and I recall snacking on walnuts but when I bit into the first walnut every single bite, tasted like the universe. Exactly and empathy goes towards the sender of messages too. That is why i didn‚Äôt suggest engaging in full conversation simply bc it might hurt their feelings. No, i said have enough empathy to at least recognize the fact that they thought and cared enough to reach out. Don‚Äôt even respond to any of the content in the message just say ‚ÄúI‚Äôm busy.‚Äù I think you should apply your last message to your self to be honest bc i see it both ways but it seems you do not.

I‚Äôm not sure how I lacked empathy? Lol i recognize they didn‚Äôt want to respond but i was suggesting a way to avoid double texts or people sending back ‚Äú???‚Äù Bc the post, to me, was high lighting how that was even MORE annoying. I will admit though i do not have empathy for people who want to complain and feel validated about their problems but fail to take proper action to set boundaries or do something about said problem. No one is a mind reader, if you want someone to fuck off simply communicate that. It‚Äôs not that hard lol.

Other people have feelings and as annoyed as you may be, they took the time to think about YOU, to try and connect with YOU, and ultimately if you don‚Äôt even respond it seems like their effort/love goes unnoticed. So try not to get so irritated and perhaps appreciate the gesture and just communicate openly that you are busy and will get back at a later time. Empathy never hurts :)

Life is only as meaningful as you make it. I used to definitely feel the same way, and even experience similar suicide ideation. I‚Äôm much more self aware and when I‚Äôm in a funk I‚Äôm able to call myself out on it and just say to myself ‚Äúso you want to sit and make yourself miserable or you ready to move on and have a good day‚Äù ultimately it is all in our head and we essentially create our realities.

Plato summed it up best, ‚ÄúI know that I know nothing.‚Äù People who are genuinely ‚Äúwoke‚Äù (don‚Äôt usually use that word lol) but they simply recognize they need to put their pride/ego to the side and accept they know nothing and control very little of what we experience. People who claim to know it all are typically those who know the least, and those who know the most claim to know nothing. It‚Äôs called the Dunning-Kruger Effect. I have not given up and I‚Äôm not feeling hopeless either. I was just hoping to highlight that the narrative of the op, to me, was reading that adverse effects were poor excuses. I was referring to the comment i replied to. They said something about working to reverse trauma.

I also disagree. You cannot reverse trauma, it‚Äôs near impossible to control yourself from thinking about trauma too. Through therapy and several other therapeutic experiences I have had I am constantly reminded my battles come from messages I learned starting as an infant and those are stored in the subconscious which we have no control of or much access too and it makes up 95% of all thought and behavior. It‚Äôs entirely hard to reverse messages you simply are unaware of.

I partly disagree. The part where the author claims ‚Äúsome bad things from childhood have an effect but overall it‚Äôs just an excuse.‚Äù We form our subconscious by the age of 7 based on the experiences we have. For people like me who were raised by narcissists, have innately learned to speak to themselves in the same way. It‚Äôs not an excuse, the reality is 95% of our thoughts are unconscious. I just feel that claiming adverse childhood effects are excuses is really a disservice to people who suffer complex-ptsd or experience personality disorders as a result of endless abuse and neglect.
